knowledge.question: The difference between a tuple and a list in Python is:
choices: a tuple is dynamic while a list is not
tuples can only contain numbers while lists can contain any type
a tuple, once created, cannot be changed
a list is faster to access than a tuple
explanation: Incorrect: Both tuples and lists are dynamic
Incorrect: Tuples can also contain any type
Correct: Tuples are immutable and cannot be modified once created
Incorrect: depending on the circumstances, this may or may not be true
